Auto: When the battery is low, the system automatically switches to Eco mode until the battery is back to normal
Remind: Remind the user to switch to Eco mode when the battery is low and return to the original mode when the battery is back to normal
The seat will automatically adjust to a comfortable driving position based on the height and weight selected

Intelligent Parking Assist helps the driver park the vehicle. For specific instructions, see below: 

1. How can I activate Intelligent Parking Assist? 
You can activate Intelligent Parking Assist in the following ways: 
① Press the (Custom) button marked with X on the left of the steering wheel. 
② Tap the "Intelligent Parking" icon on the navigation bar of the touchscreen. 
③ Wake up the voice assistant and say "I want to park". 

2. How can I find a parking space and start parking? 
Keep moving forward on the side of the road with parking spaces. 
When a parking space is found, the system will emit a sound, with the identified parking spaces displayed on the touchscreen. Select a parking space on the touchscreen and tap "Start"; to start parking. 

3. How can I prepare before starting parking? 
① Keep the vehicle parked. 
You can not release the brake until you confirm that the "Start" button is clicked and the text "Parking started. Release the brake pedal" appeared on the touchscreen. Only then release the brake to prevent the vehicle from idling. 
② Check the parking environment. 
As a assisted function, Intelligent Parking Assist can not provide the same level of accuracy as manual parking. To ensure safety while parking, please check the surroundings first. 

4. How can I stop and restart Intelligent Parking Assist in an emergency? 
① Press the brake pedal. 
② Tap "RESUME" to resume parking, or tap "Exit"to stop parking.

After Autopark is engaged, parking information prompts are displayed. This function can be accessed through voice commands, the Autopark button on the touchscreen, or a preset custom button to the left of the steering wheel. Because Autopark is not a completely autonomous driving function, you must pay attention to your surroundings when parking and be prepared to take over manual control in the event of danger.
Use your key to control Intelligent Parking Assist and Intelligent Parking Out Assist

For a narrow parking space where it would be hard to open the door, leave the vehicle and then use your key for remote parking. After a parking space is found and selected (selected by default), put the vehicle in Park, exit the vehicle, and close the door: 1. Press and hold the button on your key until the hazard lights begin to flash, indicating the vehicle has entered Wait mode. 2. Double-press the button on the key to start intelligent parking assist.
When it is enabled, you can use the key to start, pause, restart, or exit parking. Pay attention to your surroundings during this process and pause or quit remote parking in the case of any hazards.
By default, long-press the button to start remote parking.
Please double check that remote parking by key is enabled for %1$s.
Use a Bluetooth-enabled phone to control Intelligent Parking Assist and Intelligent Parking Out Assist

To park in a narrow space with Intelligent Parking Assist, connect your phone to the vehicle via Bluetooth for remote parking. When the XPILOT system identifies a parking space, put the vehicle in Park and exit the vehicle. Then connect your phone to the vehicle via Bluetooth, open the Xpeng app, and go to the parking module in the app. After verification with your fingerprint, tap the Start Parking button to start Intelligent Parking Assist. Use the mobile app for remote parking as follows:
When it is enabled, use the mobile app to start, pause, restart, or exit Intelligent Parking Assist.
By default, long-press the button to start remote parking.
Please double check that remote parking by key is enabled for %1$s.
You may select an alert chime or voice announcement as a reminder
Carry out self-inspection when boarding the vehicle

In accordance with the requirements of relevant national laws and regulations, solely electric vehicles should be able to emit a simulated noise for pedestrians when driving at low speeds, so as to minimize safety risks. The simulated low-speed noise is disabled only for this journey, and will be enabled the next time the vehicle is turned on.\n\nAre you sure you want to keep it disabled?
Put on seat belt, close doors and press brake pedal to activate.
Fully press the brake pedal to activate AutoHold

How to trigger: Switch on this function and press the brake pedal intensively. 

Trigger feedback: The vehicle can also automatically apply the brakes to remain stationary without keeping the brake pedal pressed after being triggered. You can rest your feet while waiting for the traffic light to change. 

Preconditions: The driver's seat belt is fastened, the driver side door is closed, and the vehicle is set to READY.
Ensure that your seat belt is fastened and all doors are closed, and depress the brake pedal to activate this function
With light beam enabled, all strip headlights are turned on
Operation too frequent. Please try again later.
The front hatch cover is not closed, please close it in a timely manner
The welcome chime is played when the driver enters the vehicle and closes the door
If XPILOT system detects other vehicles in the rear blind spot area, the blind spot warning lights on the exterior rear-view mirrors will turn on as shown. Please avoid changing lanes if possible.

Blind Spot Security assistance is an active reminder function and may cause unnecessary alarms. Drivers can decide whether to change lanes based on the actual situation.\n\nFor details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Save as a new driving habit

The TPMS should be calibrated every time you change tires, the vehicle should be stationary for at least 17 minutes before calibration. During calibration, please keep the vehicle speed above 40 km/h for 10 minutes and avoid reversing.
The shoes can be stored in front of front passenger seat.
Put the dark side of the mattress down, and the light \nside up, with the air nozzle on the driver\'s side.
Unfold mattress and open air nozzle
Power the air pump with the cigarette lighter in the armrest box. Inflate the mattress for one minute, \nbefore putting on the bed sheet.
First, unfold the quick-fill mattress and open the air nozzle. Then, connect the air nozzle to the air pump as shown.
Next, power on the air pump and start inflation.
Here is a final tip for mattress storage before you enter X-SLEEP.
To put away the mattress, open the air nozzle on the back of the mattress as shown in the illustration, and roll the mattress from the other side to exhaust the air.
To store the mattress, open the air nozzle on the back as \nshown in the illustration, roll the mattress gently towards the air \nnozzle to exhaust the air.

If XPILOT system detects crossing vehicles behind when parking, Door Open Warning (DOW) will turn on the blind spot warning lights on the side-view mirrors as shown in the above figure. Both the driver and passengers need to confirm whether it is safe to open the door. In this case, when trying to open the door on the side with the warning light on, sound alarms will be activated, reminding the driver or passenger of the risk.
Steadier power output for a smoother driving experience

When enabled, the system will intelligently match the acceleration and intensity of energy recovery to avoid any discomfort caused by the frequent conversion of sudden acceleration and intense energy recovery, so as to provide a more comfortable riding experience.
Currently in Stable Drive Mode. Adjust the drive mode or energy regeneration to exit it
Stable drive mode is turned off
Please disable Stable Drive Mode first and activate Slippery Road Assist
Adjust acceleration/deceleration with the accelerator pedal

Note: This mode does not replace the use of the brake pedal. To prevent slipping on slopes, press the brake pedal to stop the vehicle while in the process of stopping. If necessary, press hard on the brake pedal to activate Autohold.\nWhen on, AutoHold will reduce the use of the brake pedal, while improving energy regeneration and expanding the vehicle\'s range.

Once ECO Plus is activated, the energy regeneration will be enhanced to play the best cruising ability. Vehicle will not crawl. To avoid slipping, AutoHold function will be activated automatically. Slippery Road Assist will be deactivated automatically. Please drive cautiously.
ABS fault. Failed to change energy recovery level or turn on XPEDAL.
Please deactivate XPEDAL before activating Slippery Road Assist
Steady dynamic response for a longer range
TIPS: Drive mode will be reset to standard and energy regeneration reset to high by each time starting
Fast dynamic response for speed and fun
Medium dynamic response for a good balance
Currently in X-Pedal drive mode. Adjust the drive mode or energy regeneration to exit
The seat belt automatically tightens when the Forward Collision Mitigation is activated
Seat belt automatically tightens when XPILOT Driving is active and the vehicle is straddling a lane
Location%s is empty, unable to switch
When emergency braking, the emergency brake light will be lit up to prevent rear-end collisions

How to trigger: Switch on this function and use the emergency brake when the speed is over 80 km/h. \n\nTrigger feedback: the emergency brake light will be lit up to avoid rear-end collisions from the emergency braking situation.
When this function is disabled, the driver\'s seat belt does not automatically tighten when a Forward Collision Mitigation is triggered.\nDisable the seat belt?
When disabled, the seat belt will not provide any warning. \nAre you sure you want to keep it off?
When Emergency Lane Keeping (ELK) is disabled, the system will not respond to a potential side impact. \n\nDisable ELK?

If XPILOT system detects that the vehicle is drifting out of its lane or has already drifted out of its lane and a side collision may occur, Emergency Lane Keeping (ELK) will briefly assist the driver by taking emergency control of the steering wheel to avoid or mitigate any injuries caused by a side collision. 

Though Emergency Lane Keeping (ELK) is an active function, it does not always work. When the lane departure is beyond ELK's correction ability, the system will not be able to correct the vehicle position. Therefore, the driver should always bring the vehicle under control and observe their surroundings, and should not rely on ELK for emergency situations.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Emergency dynamic braking can be triggered by pulling and holding the EPB switch, which can be found to the lower left of the steering wheel.
Currently in Stable Drive Mode. Adjust the drive mode or energy regeneration to exit it
High energy regeneration enables a longer driving range
Low energy regeneration ensures a better driving experience
Medium energy regeneration keeps a good balance
Currently in X-Pedal drive mode. Adjust the drive mode or energy regeneration to exit
Please Keep The Vehicle Standstill And Press The Brake
In the Geek Mode, please go to the Geek Editor to adjust the Electronic Stability Program parameters.
辅助驾驶NGP工作中，暂不支持调节
Unable to adjust the Steering Assist. Please straighten the steering wheel at low speed and try again
Driving Assist is working. Adjustment is not supported now.
The Electronic Stability Program parameters cannot be adjusted in the Light Chasing Mode.
Function fault. Unable to turn it on.
It will keep the vehicle stable to prevent drifting or skidding

Trigger: When this function is enabled (enabled automatically upon power-on), it is automatically triggered to prevent drifting or skidding on sharp turns or slick roads. 

Function trigger feedback: Ensuring the car's stability. 

Function description: This system includes the electronic brake distribution system (EBD), anti-lock brake system (ABS), tracking control system (TCS), vehicle dynamic control system (VDC).
This function is disabled and switches to standard when the car is traveling at over 120km/h.
Auto enabled when starting to drive/traveling at high speeds
Unable to disable ESP when driving at high speed

Please exit the Geek Mode first.

Please exit the RAGE mode first.
Please exit the Trailer mode first.
Please exit the X-Pedal mode first.
Please exit the X-Pedal mode first.
X-Pedal mode exited. Please pay attention to braking safety.
If you turn off the fatigue and distraction alerts, all alerts in-vehicle visual system will be turned off.
When it is deactivated, fatigue and distraction alerts will be unavailable.
Forward collision warning and braking assistance

It is strongly recommended not to disable Forward Collision Mitigation. Otherwise, the vehicle will not be able to give a warning or assist the brake when a risk of collision is detected. \n\nAre you sure to disable Forward Collision Mitigation?

XPILOT Driving Assist alerts the driver with visual and audio warnings via the dashboard when a high risk of front collision is detected. It assists the driver to brake in an emergency to avoid or reduce the impact of the front collision. When the Advanced Emergency Braking (AEB) is triggered, the dashboard will send the following visual warning with a short, quick sound. At the same time, the seat belt will tighten up to minimize the harm from a potential collision. 

Forward collision warning is a driving assistance function and is not able to avoid all collisions. Speed, weather, and tire performance affect the collision warning performance. Please keep a reasonable distance from other vehicles and drive cautiously.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Sufficient battery. Switched to %s mode automatically
当前电量充足，帮你切换回%s模式，好吗？
The vehicle will actively reduce its speed when going downhill

How to trigger: Switch on this function and run at a low speed on slope. 

Trigger feedback: After HDC is triggered, the driver does not need to hold the brake downhill. The vehicle will speed down automatically to keep stable pilot. 

Preconditions: 
1) Speed ≤ 40 km/h for activation; Speed > 64 km/h for auto-off; Hill Descent Control (HDC) is available for speed ≥ 8 km/h but ≤ 38 km/h 
2) Normal temperature of brake disc 
3) Normal ESP system 
4) Downhill ascent less than 50% but not plain
After Activated, The Vehicle Will Actively Reduce Its Speed When Going Downhill.
Windows are locked and cannot be closed automatically when driving at high speed
Windows have been closed due to the high speed

Windows will be closed due to the high speed. Please pay attention to your safety
Windows are closed automatically after driving at high speed for a certain time

Air quality is poor, and XFreeBreath™ has been activated

The system automatically or reminds the user to close windows and turn on XFreeBreath when the air quality is poor
REFRESH exited. To avoid getting your fingers trapped, please adjust the windows as needed.
主驾空调温度|空调温度
When turned on, XFreeBreath continuously monitors the PM2.5 and purifies the air in the vehicle
副驾空调温度|空调温度
Smart passenger ventilation enabled. Passenger-side ventilation will be disabled when not needed to save power.

The MAX A/C function is applicable for in-car scenario wherein the temperature is relatively high in summer. After the function is enabled, the inside temperature could drop to around 25℃ in 180s to enhance the driving comfort.\n\nREFRESH is applicable for purifying the air of newly-purchased vehicles or for getting rid of any unpleasant smells during driving quickly. After the function is enabled, the ventilation system will keep working for 180s to enhance the driving comfort.
Operation not supported in this mode
Keep at least one air vent open

When low beams are turned on, this function will be activated and continuously detect surroundings. When it detects a vehicle ahead or sufficient road illumination, the high beams will be automatically turned off to avoid interfering with other traffic participants.
\n请在最新版手机APP中，购买XPILOT3.0服务
Turn off the intelligent high beam
Turn on the intelligent high beam
This is only available after activation.
Preparing Intelligent High Beams... Please wait 1 minute and try again
Please restart the vehicle in order to activate Intelligent High Beams

The system\'s recognition of speed limit signs is no substitute for the driver\'s visual observation. When disabled, the driver will no longer be prompted to confirm when adjusting the cruise speed, which may result in inaccuracies. It is recommended that you do not disable it.
When enabled, the driver must confirm whenever the cruise speed is adjusted via the cruise control lever.

Intelligent Speed Limit Control may encounter omissions or errors while recognizing speed limit signs and cannot replace the driver\'s own visual observation in controlling the vehicle’s speed. Please do not overly rely on this feature and remember that the driver is responsible for the appropriate adjustment of their vehicle speed at all times.
Provides speed limit alerts and adjusts the vehicle\'s cruise speed
When passing a road speed limit sign, the system will successfully recognize the speed limit sign, and provide a prompt on the dashboard as shown in the above figure.

The above prompt will last for a few seconds. If the driver confirms that the speed limit information recognized by the system is correct and intends to limit the vehicle's speed, they can simply flick the cruise control lever towards their chest as shown in A in the figure above.

If the action is not confirmed by you before the prompt disappears, the vehicle's speed will not be adjusted according to the current speed limit. 

As Intelligent Speed Limit Control is a driving assistance function and may encounter omissions or errors while recognizing speed limit signs, please limit your speed and drive safely.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.

A low speed limit range may result in more inaccurate cruise speed adjustments owing to increased disturbance by road signs. It is recommended that you set the range above 50 km/h.


Are you sure you want to change the range?
Personalize the vehicle\'s speed limit range and pattern
Please select Adjust in Speed Limit Assist first
Only respond to speed limit values within the following range
Adjust the speed with Intelligent Speed Limit Control
If XPILOT system detects speed limit information ahead, it will present the information on the dashboard as shown below, and synchronously adjust the current cruise speed.

When the limitation information provided by the Intelligent Speed Limit Control is inaccurate, please control the speed according to actual requirements.\n\nFor details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Please enable LCC again after passing the test
Congratulations. You have passed the LCC safety test

The Intelligent Cruising Assistance (ICA) and Traffic Jam Assistance (TJA) with Lane Center Control (LCC) are still driving assistance functions and cannot achieve automatic piloting of the vehicle. When using this function, the driver must focus on the road conditions and control the steering wheel (as shown in the figure above) to take over control of the vehicle at any time. When this function is available, a gray steering wheel icon is displayed to the right of the speed (see the image).

Lane Center Control (LCC) is mainly used in open highway scenarios. Please do not use it on complicated and changeable urban roads. The following typical environments may significantly impact LCC and must be used cautiously: 
- Rainy, snowy, smoggy, flooded or other unfavorable environments; 
- Road construction, reflective roads at night, extreme slopes, lines on the road which are faded in color or in disorder, and other disadvantageous environments.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Assist the driver to maintain the vehicle in the middle of the lane

1. Function Activation 
When LCC is ready, move the shift lever downwards twice to the bottom position (i.e. the XPILOT gear) and release it to activate ACC and LCC simultaneously. In this case, the driver only needs to hold the steering wheel lightly. 

2. Activation Conditions 
This function can be activated on straight roads with clear lane lines. The LCC icon on the dashboard will appear in gray, indicating that the function is ready. 
Once the function is activated, the LCC icon will change from gray to blue. 

3. Function Deactivation 
To manually deactivate LCC, move the shift lever upwards and release or press the brake pedal. The steering wheel icon on the touchscreen will turn gray, indicating that the LCC is exited. 

4. Parameter Adjustment 
Press the left and right arrow buttons on the left side of the steering wheel to increase and decrease the following distance. Press the up and down arrow buttons to increase and decrease the cruise speed. Press once to increase/decrease the cruise speed by 5 km/h. Press and hold to increase/decrease the speed by 1 km/h. 

LCC cannot realize completely automatic driving of the vehicle. Please follow local laws and regulations and keep an eye on road situation. You should cautiously use the function especially under bad weather and at intersections since XPILOT will be greatly affected in such situations.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Poor network connection. Enabling failed. Please try again
If the driver is absent and no operations occur within 1 hour, the vehicle will automatically power down
Automatically lock or unlock all doors when you approach or leave the vehicle with the key
When doors are closed and driver seat empty, hold the key and walk away to auto-lock
When doors are closed and driver seat empty, hold the key nearby to auto-unlock
Select whether the XPILOT sound alerts should be provided in a detailed or concise way
LCC can only be turned on after watching the above video while in P

ALC is designed to be used on clear highways. When LCC is activated and the speed is above %1$d km/h, the driver can give lane change orders by stirring the turn signals switch and ALC will assist the driver in changing lanes. 

ALC is only an assisted function and cannot realize full autonomous driving of the vehicle. When using this function, the driver should always check road safety and be ready to take control of the vehicle during the lane changing process. This function must be used in lanes with clear lines but without sideways. 

Please note that ensuring safety is the driver's primary responsibility and we hope that you can use ALC in the right way. 

Before using ALC, make sure that the blind safety detection is activated, or ALC will be unavailable. 

The turn signals will not be automatically turned off when the lane change is completed. 

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual. 

Are you sure to activate ALC?

Assisted Lane Change is designed to be mainly used in clear high-way. When LCC is activated and the speed is higher than 45 km/h, the driver can turn on the turn signals to give the order and Assisted Lane Change will facilitate the lane changing process for the driver. 

Assisted Lane Change is only a driving assistance function and cannot realize automatic driving of the vehicle. When using this function, the driver shall always confirm the road safety and be ready to take over the vehicle during the lane changing process. This function must be used in lanes with clear lines but without sideways. 

Please note that ensuring safety is the driver's primary responsibility. We hope that drivers shall take advantage of the Assisted Lane Change function in the right way. 

When you use the Assisted Lane Change function, please guarantee that the Blind Spot Security function is enabled or you will fail to use ALC. 

After ALC is completed, the turn signals will not be automatically turned off. 

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual. 

Enable Assisted Lane Change?
Toggle the turn signal switch to control ALC

ALC is an extended intelligent driving assist function. When driving on the highway or expressway, the driver can use ALC to facilitate the lane change without interrupting LCC, so as to enhance the continuity of Intelligent Driving Assist. 

With both BSD and ALC enabled, ALC will become available when LCC is activated at a speed above %1$d km/h. 

You can toggle the turn signal switch to give orders to ALC. When the turn signal is on, the system will wait for a lane change with the following tips displayed on the dashboard

ALC is an extended function of intelligent driving. When the vehicle is running on highway, the driver can use ALC to facilitate the lane changing process without interrupting LCC so as to enhance the continuity of intelligent driving assistance. 

When the Blind Spot Security function is enabled, after turning on ALC, it will become available when LCC is enabled and driving speed is above 45 km/h. 

You can use the turn signal switch to give ALC orders. When the turn signal is on, the system will enter into the status of waiting for changing lanes and then the dashboard will present the following reminder:

When waiting for the lane change, the XPILOT system will judge the necessary conditions for changing lanes. The vehicle will start to change lines when all the conditions have been met. 

Please note that the XPILOT system has limitations on determining conditions for changing lanes. The driver is obliged to confirm the safety of the surroundings. 

If the system determines that it is not the right time to change the lane, the operation will not be performed. In this case, the following tips will be dispalyed on the dashboard: 

When the lane change is completed or canceled, the driver needs to restore the turn signal manually. 

Once ALC is activated, if the vehicle has not crossed the boundary of the current lane, the driver can stir the switch to the opposite direction or restore the switch to cancel lane changing. If the vehicle has already crossed the boundary of the current lane, the driver cannot cancel the operation by stirring the turn signal switch. Instead, the driver needs to take over the steering wheel to control the vehicle and cancel ALC. 

Safety instructions: 
The ALC system may fail to recognize vehicles that suddenly approach this vehicle crosswise. The driver should be alert to such scenarios and take control of the vehicle before potential hazards occur to avoid traffic accidents. You should cautiously use ALC especially under bad weather and in congested road sections since XPILOT system will be affected in such situations.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Please enable Lane Departure Warning first
在车道居中辅助（增强版）开启过程中，前方有静止的障碍物，且系统检测周围环境安全、行驶状态符合条件时，可发起跨车道线绕行障碍物。当系统执行绕行动作时，可能侵占旁边车道，需要您全程保持关注，必要时接管车辆。\n请您阅读完毕后，再次确认是否开启该功能。
车道居中辅助（增强版）开启时，可以支持跨越虚车道线绕行障碍物

When XPILOT system detects that the vehicle drifts from its lane unintentionally, the lane on the dashboard will turn red with alarms to remind the driver. The steering wheel will vibrate lightly (this vibration does not affect driving safety) to keep the driver focused on driving.

Lane Departure Warning (LDW) is an active reminder function and cannot guide the vehicle to its original lane. Please drive the vehicle to the correct lane when the warning occurs.\n\nFor details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
Scroll to adjust the height of Steering Wheel.
Headlights take some time to turn off after locking

Lane Departure Assist will correct the vehicle's position when it deviates from its lane without the turn signals on. However, you still need to focus on driving since this function cannot replace the driver and may not work well for all types of lane departure.

Please read the User Manual carefully before use. 

Wipers and dual flashing lights will prevent the function from being enabled. 

Are you sure you want to turn on this function?
A warning or correction will be triggered when the driver is distracted and unintentionally drifts out of the lane

Lane Departure Assist includes Lane Departure Warning (LDW) and Lane Keeping Assist (LKA), which prompts warning or corrects vehicle position when the vehicle deviates from its lane. 

Lane Departure Warning 

When XPILOT system detects that the vehicle deviates from its lane unconsciously, the lane on the dashboard will turn red with alarms to remind the driver. Lane Deviation Warning (LDW) is an active reminder function and cannot lead the vehicle to its original lane. Please adjust the vehicle's position when the warning occurs. 

Lane Keeping Assist 

When XPILOT system finds that the vehicle deviates from its lane, the function will lead the vehicle back to its lane. When the vehicle deviates and the driver is not holding the steering wheel, a warning signal will be displayed on the dashboard with alarms to remind the driver. Though Lane Keeping Assist (LKA) is an active function, it does not always work. When the lane departure is beyond LKA's correction ability, the system will not be able to correct the vehicle position. Therefore, the driver should always bring the vehicle under control and should not rely on LKA for the correction of lane departure.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.

We invited the professional sound collection team from XX to go deep into the valleys in Yunnan to find the echoes from Shangri-La.

The echoes of Shangri-La may be those of small river flowing and big river rising, or those of breeze blowing, thundering, insect and bird singing, cock crowing and dog barking.

A proverb in Yunnan says: Every leaf in Yunnan dances, and every stone in Yunnan sings. Even a butterfly flaps its wings in rhythm, and the crop plays a melody when jointing.
Sea melting into sky, you can\'t tell them apart.\n\nI can\'t forget the feeling of fresh and humid sea breeze with the smell of the sea blowing the hair.
Every leaf in Yunnan dances, and every stone in Yunnan sings. Even a butterfly flaps its wings in rhythm, and the crop plays a melody when jointing.
Sea melting into sky, you can\'t tell them apart.\n\nI can\'t forget the feeling of fresh and humid sea breeze with the smell of the sea blowing the hair.
Adjusting the passenger seat angle, turning on the passenger seat massage and rhythm for you
考试通过后，请重新打开停车场记忆泊车
恭喜你，停车场记忆泊车考试已通过
地下停车场设定路线的辅助驾驶

停车场记忆泊车（测试版）是XPILOT3.0系统通过学习泊车路线实现的辅助驾驶功能。
本功能当前仅适用于地下停车场，在驾驶员的有效监控下，完成按照设定的泊车路线从起点至您的车位的高等级辅助驾驶。
-如何开启？
首先，您需要在地下停车场手动驾驶车辆教会系统学习您的泊车路线。
然后，学习路线完成后离开停车场回到地面，再次到达您的泊车路线起点时，点击提示卡片即可使用停车场记忆泊车功能。

-功能开启后可以帮助您做什么？
停车场记忆泊车可以辅助驾驶车辆按照设定路线前往您的车位，避让缓行的行人和车辆，最终泊入您的车位。

-注意事项：
*停车场记忆泊车是基于P7智尊版所具备的XPILOT3.0硬件系统，通过购买XPILOT3.0软件及升级服务获得。
*功能开启前，请您确保已经开启超级智能辅助泊车功能。
*请您确保在安全，适宜的地下停车场使用本功能，在使用过程中请您保持对环境的观察，在有安全风险或系统提示时做好随时接管车辆的准备，掌控车辆方向及刹车、电门。
*请您注意，设定泊车路线时遵守停车场的指示，切勿逆行。
*停车场记忆泊车目前仍是测试版状态，无法应对所有场景，在遇到快速奔跑的行人或穿行车辆时，要提前接管车辆。请您在合适场景下，安全使用本功能。
Turn on the Super-Intelligent Parking Assist first
请在最新版手机APP中进行激活，全程大约15分钟。（如未购买XPILOT3.0，请先购买）
教育视频等自动驾驶提供，先使用车道居中辅助教育视频\n在P挡下观看完上方视频后，才能打开停车场记忆泊车
停车场记忆泊车功能准备中，请在1分钟后重试
请重新启动车辆，以便激活停车场记忆泊车

When enabled, you can use the NFC card to unlock, lock and start the vehicle.

考试通过后，请重新打开高速导航辅助驾驶功能
恭喜你，高速导航辅助驾驶考试已通过
在P挡下观看完上方视频后，才能使用高速自主驾驶(测试版)功能
NGP依据导航路径辅助驾驶

高速导航辅助驾驶 Navigation Guided Pilot（NGP）是XPILOT3.0系统结合导航路径实现的辅助驾驶功能。
本功能适用于常见的高速公路与部分城市快速路，在驾驶员的有效监控下，完成从A点到B点的辅助驾驶。

-如何开启？
当您驾驶进入可用范围时，系统会发出相应提示，此时保证车辆在车道线清晰主路上，连续下压两次拨杆即可开启本功能。

-功能开启后可以帮助您做什么？
开启后，系统将按照导航路径实现超越慢车、选择快速车道、合入主路和进出匝道切换高速等能力。例如：前方出现慢行车辆时，会选择进入更加快速车道进行超车，保证您的通行效率；导航路线需要离开高速时，会智能辅助换入匝道对应车道。若需更多设置，可以通过点击“自定义NGP”，更改自主变道提醒方式等设置。

-注意事项：
*高速导航辅助驾驶NGP是基于P7智尊版所具备的XPILOT3.0硬件系统，通过购买XPILOT3.0软件及升级服务获得。
*功能开启前，请您确保已经开启车道居中辅助和智能辅助变道功能。
*请您确保在安全，适用的场景下使用本功能，在使用过程中请您保持对环境的观察，手扶方向盘，在有安全风险或系统提示时做好随时接管车辆的准备，掌控车辆方向及刹车电门。
*请您注意，高速导航辅助驾驶功能使用过程中，您仍需要遵守交通规则，注意车速，保证安全驾驶。
*高速导航辅助驾驶NGP目前仍是测试版状态，无法应对所有场景，包括常见的恶劣天气、不佳路况、道路施工或极端交通情况。请您在合适场景下，安全使用本功能。
高速导航辅助驾驶（NGP）测试版
请先打开 车道居中辅助 和 智能辅助变道
当前网络环境差，开启失败，请重试
超车条件满足时，智能辅助变换车道

此选项适用于高速自主导航开启后，遇到慢车自主超越时，变道的风格与体验。
-运动风格下，自主变道行为会更加快速，高效；
-舒适模式下，自主变道行为会更加柔和，平缓；
-选择关闭，系统则不再执行超越慢车的操作。
*以上更改，不会影响功能或变道过程中的使用安全。但仍需您在系统自主变道前观察对应侧路况，存在危险时立即接管车辆。

在高速自主驾驶工作时，系统将自主执行超车，下匝道等变道行为。
开启该功能后，自主变道将无需您二次确认，提供更好的使用体验。
此功能目前仍为测试版本，因此变道过程中请您保持观察路况，必要时手动接管车辆保证安全。
确定要开启该功能吗？
条件符合时将自主变道，无需确认
在进入高速自主驾驶功能后，系统将在主路，或隧道前优先进入左侧快速车道，从而保证通行效率。\n变道过程中请您保持观察路况，必要时手动接管车辆保证安全。\n确定要开启该功能吗？
进入隧道前，自主并入快速车道
在夜间使用高速导航辅助驾驶功能，系统会在需要超越慢行车辆时，自动进行远近灯光切换，从而达到提醒前车司机，保证超车安全的目的。\n此功能目前为测试版本，受限于当前传感器性能限制，可能会产生不必要的灯光调整，后续将持续优化与提升。\n请您在阅读完毕后，再次确认是否开启该功能。
夜间超越慢行车辆时，进行远近灯光提醒
夜间超车灯光提醒(测试版)
在高速导航辅助驾驶过程中，若出现不得不与货车等大型车辆并行时，为了保证驾驶安全，系统会调整自车姿态，在车道内远离此类车辆。\n此功能目前为测试版本，可能会导致一些误调整等行为，后续将持续优化与提升。\n确定要开启该功能吗？
与大型车辆并行时，调整车道内位置适当远离大型车辆

该功能后，将支持NGP工作中，通过语音小P发起智能辅助变道指令。在您发起命令前，请先观察对应侧车道情况， 确认安全可变道后再使用此功能。
需注意：
1. 语音控制变道暂时仅支持主驾发起语音命令；
2. 变道过程中无法通过语音控制车辆，如有危险，请立即接管方向盘
NGP启动后，可以通过语音发起智能辅助变道

Detects cross traffic in your blindspot when reversing

If XPILOT system detects crossing vehicles behind when reversing, the blind spot warning lights on the side-view mirrors will turn on as shown in the above figure. In this case, the driver should pay more attention to the reversing situation.

Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) is an active reminder function and may cause unnecessary alarms. Drivers can decide whether to continue reversing based on the actual situation.\n\nFor details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.
RCTA is a driver assistance feature
Detects rear collision threats when driving

When driving, XPILOT detects other cars approaching your car from the front or rear. When it detects a risk of collision, the dashboard displays a warning. RCW is an active reminder function and may cause unnecessary alarms. Drivers can decide whether to continue driving based on the actual situation.\n\nFor details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.

Remember to check the rear seats. Do not leave your children or items in the Vehicle!
Remember to check the rear seats. Do not leave your children or items in the Vehicle!
You can control car movements with your key/mobile phone from a short distance away.

When you need to enter your car, but it is not in a position where you can easily open the door, you can use the summoning function to move the car forward or backward from outside. The vehicle summoning function can be used through your key or mobile phone: 

① To use the key: Long-press the P button on the key. The car lights will blink twice to indicate it is waiting for control instructions. Then, you can use the lock button to move the car forward or unlock the button to move it backward. The car will move in a straight line and stop when you release the button. 

② To use your mobile phone: After leaving the car, connect your phone to the car via Bluetooth and open the Xpeng app. Then, go to the parking module in the mobile app. After being verified with your fingerprint, you can long-press Summon Forward or Summon Backward. 
The remote parking and car summoning functions are convenient auxiliary functions, but do not represent fully autonomous parking. The driver must always observe the vehicle and the surrounding environment. During the process, the driver must ensure the key is always near the car.

For details, please refer to the relevant parts in the User Manual.

After activating this function, you can use your key or mobile app to move the car forward or backward from a short distance away. Please be aware of your surroundings when moving the car and stop moving in the case of any hazards.
When activated, you could view the exterior camera remotely from your phone app.

When lock and leave the vehicle, you could view the exterior camera remotely from XPENG app, for vehicle security. With end-to-end encryption, XPENG has no access to your camera data. /n You can turn off the Remote Camera View anytime.

The system\'s recognition of speed limit signs cannot take the place of the driver\'s visual observation. When \"Auto\" is selected, the driver will no longer be prompted to confirm when the cruise speed is regulated, which may result in incorrect speed regulation actions. Do not overly rely on this function to regulate the Vehicle\'s speed. Are you sure you want to enter the Auto Adjusting Mode?
Adjust Vehicle speed manually or automatically based on speed limit
When the Vehicle passes a speed limit sign and the system successfully recognizes it, a prompt will be displayed on the dashboard as shown in the above figure.

The above prompt will last for a few seconds. If the driver confirms that the speed limit information recognized by the system is correct and intends to limit the Vehicle\'s speed, he/she can simply flick the Lever towards their chest as shown in Direction A in the figure above. If the prompt on the dashboard is not confirmed before disappearing, the Vehicle\'s speed will not be adjusted according to the current speed limit. As Speed Limit Assist is a driving assistance function and may have omissions or errors when recognizing speed limit signs, please limit your speed and drive safely. For details, please refer to the relevant sections in the User Manual.

Connect to Bluetooth of the projector
Remove the headrest on the middle rear seat.
Install the projector on the stand customized for P5, insert the legs of the stand into the holes on the headrest, and connect the projector to the power supply behind and underneath the headrest.

To watch movies with the on-board sound system, connect to the projector via Bluetooth on the touchscreen. The theater sound effect will be automatically enabled. All speakers are fine-tuned to deliver massive sonic impact while accurately reproducing the nuances.
Hang the projection screen customized for P5 on the hooks below the two sun visors.

Put down the Air mattress for P5 to create a cushioned, flat surface for you to sleep on. Coupling this with a memory cotton pillow, you can easily turn your car into a bedroom.
“Create a relaxing and cozy sleeping space with a front windshield sunblind and window curtains.”
Ease your mind with a select set of relaxing sleep music and calming scents. Wake up stress-free with an alarm clock that plays a soothing piece of music.
Invisible from Outside for More Freedom During Sleep
Fall Asleep Quickly and Wake Up Refreshed
Leaving X-SLEEP will automatically cancel the alarm clock.

Speed Limit Assist may have omissions or errors when recognizing speed limit signs and cannot replace the driver\'s visual observation and control of Vehicle speed. Please do not overly rely on this feature and remember that the driver is responsible for the appropriate adjustment of their Vehicle speed.\n\nAre you sure you want to activate Speed Limit Assist?
The Vehicle displays the speed limit values, gives alarms or adjust the speed according to the road speed limit

The system\'s recognition of speed limit signs cannot take the place of the driver\'s visual observation. When this function is deactivated, the driver will no longer be prompted to confirm when the cruise speed is adjusted, which may result in incorrect speed regulation actions.\n\nAre you sure you want to deactivate it?
When this function is activated, the driver must confirm whenever the Cruise Speed is adjusted via the Cruise Control Lever.
Please select the Speed Adjusting option under the Speed Limit Assist.
When it is activated, beeps will be given every time the speed limit value change is detected.
When it is activated, alarm sounds will be given when the overspeed condition is met.
Please select the Alarm or the Speed Adjusting option under the Speed Limit Assist.
you have to manually adjust to continue
行车中不支持座椅调节，需要手动调节哦
No operation on the trunk is allowed while driving
Hardware fault of front left corner millimeter wave radar
Hardware fault of front right corner millimeter wave radar
Hardware fault of rear left corner millimeter wave radar
Hardware fault of rear right corner millimeter wave radar
Limits acceleration when an obstacle is detected in front of the Vehicle when starting.

When an obstacle is detected in the front and the driver depresses the accelerator pedal too fast, the Vehicle\'s power response will be reduced by limiting the requested torque and the rise rate of the torque so as to give the driver more time to brake, thus avoiding collision or reducing collision loss.
The maximum acceleration will not be limited when the Vehicle starts.
The maximum acceleration will be limited if an obstacle is detected in front when the Vehicle starts.
Entering X-PLAY. Make sure that the front headrests are removed and the rear seats are unoccupied.
Entering X-SLEEP. Make sure that the front headrests are removed and the rear seats are unoccupied.
Unable to activate due to high speed.
Use the steering wheel control to adjust the angle and position
Please shift to the P Gear, and then adjust the steering wheel.
In the Geek Mode, please go to the Geek Editor to adjust the Steering Assist parameters.
In the Light Chasing Mode, the most suitable steering assistance will be matched and cannot be adjusted by the driver.
This function is unavailable when the car is traveling at over 100km/h.
When this function is enabled, steering wheel function button operations are judged based on driving data and driving scenarios to prevent accidental presses.
Reduce chance of steering wheel button used accidentally
When enabled, the bottom of the front speaker will be lit up

The trailer hook will be retracted after exit. To avoid damage, confirm that the towed object has been removed. Are you sure that you want to exit?
After enabled, the towbar spreads and can be used for towing other vehicles

After opening, the trailer hook will automatically extend behind the vehicle, please ensure the safety of the rear area. To tow a large object such as a house, please turn on the trailer mode at the same time.
Please exit the Suspension Maintenance mode first.
Please exit the X-Pedal mode first.
Please check whether any foreign matter is stuck on the trailer hook and press the reset button to reset the trailer hook status.
Please open the trailer hook first

The following conditions are required for enabling Rescue Mode
1. The vehicle is in P or N
2. The brake is pressed
3. Charging gun is not inserted
4. Exit the Trailer mode and Suspension Maintenance mode
Failed to turn it on due to malfunction
Caution! Vehicle remains in N after exiting Rescue Mode.

After the trailer mode is turned on, the vehicle will 
 + 1. adapt the driving mode to enhance the drag room conditions 
 + stability of the vehicle
 + 2. disable air suspension height adjustment

1. Before enabling Rescue Mode, please put the vehicle in P or N, press the brake, and pull out the charging gun\n2. After enabling the Rescue Mode, put the vehicle in N and release the EPB\n3. Please be careful while in Rescue Mode since you cannot change gears.
After turning it on, the state of the vehicle will be adjusted, and the RV will be towed

After this mode is turned on, the vehicle will automatically adjust to a more suitable state for towing a large house. The following conditions need to be met when opening: 
 + 1. Vehicle is in P 
 + 2. Trailer hook turned on 
 + 3. Exit X-Pedal 
 + 4. Turn off suspension leveling and suspension repair mode

When the wipers are in INT and set to “Automatic”, Auto Vision Windshield Wipers will be activated, which can adjust the wiper speed based on the amount of rain accumulated on the windshield glass. nAuto Vision Windshield Wipers is still in beta the wiper speed may differ from your expectations. You also have the option to manually adjust control of the wiper speed between LO and HI. \nPrompt: When washing your car, please ensure that wipers are turned off by setting them to OFF.”

INT: Slow Interval Wipers.\nAdjusting between “Slow/Medium/Fast/Rapid/Automatic” will only be active when the wipers are rotated to the INT position. nIn particular, “Automatic” will only be displayed when the following settings are enabled.
INT: Slow Interval Wipers.\nAdjusting between “Low/Medium/High/Ultra” will only be active when the wipers are rotated to the INT position.
Only active when wipers are rotated to the INT position

Please shift to P and turn off the wipers using the switch to the left of the steering wheel.

Voice prompts and help for XPILOT
Failed to enable XPILOT computing platform. Please try again
XPILOT computing platform is turning off. Please wait
XPILOT computing platform turning on. Please wait
XPILOT is currently unavailable in your region
Activating this function will disable the XPILOT system.
Once you have disabled Battery Saver mode, the XPILOT computing platform will be enabled. It takes some time to activate this function and you cannot use the switch during this process.

Once you have activated Battery Saver mode, the XPILOT computing platform will be disabled, and you can no longer use XPILOT fuction. \nNotes: This mode should only be used in situations where it is absolutely necessary to conserve power. We do not recommend using it during normal conditions. It will take some time to activate this function and you cannot use the switch during this process.
